cycloneMessage.issuingUnit: NWS NATIONAL HURRICANE CENTER MIAMI FL
cycloneMessage.message:
ZCZC MIATCPEP2 ALL
TTAA00 KNHC DDHHMM

BULLETIN
Tropical Depression Norma Advisory Number  21
NWS National Hurricane Center Miami FL       EP172017
900 AM MDT Tue Sep 19 2017

...NORMA EXPECTED TO BECOME A REMNANT LOW IN A DAY OR SO...


SUMMARY OF 900 AM MDT...1500 UTC...INFORMATION
----------------------------------------------
LOCATION...21.6N 114.5W
ABOUT 305 MI...495 KM WSW OF CABO SAN LUCAS MEXICO
MAXIMUM SUSTAINED WINDS...35 MPH...55 KM/H
PRESENT MOVEMENT...W OR 275 DEGREES AT 5 MPH...7 KM/H
MINIMUM CENTRAL PRESSURE...1006 MB...29.71 INCHES


WATCHES AND WARNINGS
--------------------
There are no coastal watches or warnings in effect.


DISCUSSION AND 48-HOUR OUTLOOK
------------------------------
At 900 AM MDT (1500 UTC), the center of Tropical Depression Norma
was located near latitude 21.6 North, longitude 114.5 West. The
depression is moving toward the west near 5 mph (7 km/h).  A turn
to the west-northwest is expected to occur by tonight.

Maximum sustained winds remain near 35 mph (55 km/h) with higher
gusts.  Weakening is forecast, and Norma is expected to degenerate
into a remnant low on Wednesday.

The estimated minimum central pressure is 1006 mb (29.71 inches).


HAZARDS AFFECTING LAND
----------------------
None.


NEXT ADVISORY
-------------
Next complete advisory at 300 PM MDT.

$$
Forecaster Cangialosi

NNNN
